meanings.definition: Stubborn refusal to obey rules or follow instructions.
meanings.sent1: Her recalcitrance to do her chores led to a time-out.
meanings.sent2: The student's recalcitrance to listen to the teacher caused disruptions in class.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's recalcitrance to eat vegetables made mealtime a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrance of the wild horse made it impossible to tame.
meanings.sent5: His recalcitrance was like a brick wall, impossible to break through.

meanings.definition: Unwillingness to cooperate or be compliant.
meanings.sent1: The employee's recalcitrance to attend the meeting frustrated the team.
meanings.sent2: Her recalcitrance to follow the safety protocols put everyone at risk.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed recalcitrance when asked to take a bath.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrance of the old computer to turn on was frustrating.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrance of the storm to pass delayed the outdoor event.

meanings.sent1: The group's recalcitrance towards the new manager caused tension in the office.
meanings.sent2: His recalcitrance to the strict rules resulted in disciplinary action.
meanings.sent3: The tree's recalcitrance to be pruned made the garden look wild.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrance of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrance of the protesters to disperse led to a stand-off with the police.
